poem:
"Voices of the Unseen"

Behind bars,
an unexpected forum,
Russian lover, failed,
relays stories in sequin dresses.

Classified whispers
prowl the night, perpetrated
by a husband's absent touch.

Innocence bathed in betrayal,
the sting of trust severed,
tragic in its routine.

From the visiting room,
a chorus of filtered truth -
Outside, a world remains ignorant and unkind.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Jailed as collaborators: the stories of Ukrainians who ended up in prison A longstanding supporter of Russia who shared classified information about Ukrainian troop movements. A woman who said her husband had secretly sent information and maps to the Russians using her phone. Another woman targeted by online flirting that turned out to be a Russian intelligence sting. One by one, the prisoners entered the visiting room to tell their stories. The women were dressed". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
